Sang-woo considers trading it for snacks instead. But the store owner scolds him harshly, and he runs away in a panic. Soon, he's lost and crying. Thankfully, an old man passing by gives him a ride back near home. Sang-woo realizes the world doesn't always go your way… But sometimes, there are kind people who help you when things get hard. And someone who always shows that kindness, no matter what— Grandma. "Where are you going?" This time, it's Sang-woo who leads the way home. He lies on the wooden floor, lost in thought. Little by little… ever so slowly... Sang-woo's heart is beginning to grow. The sound of the rain starts to echo inside him. He doesn't know why—but the moment feels unsettling as the laundry gets drenched. So he brings it in. The rain stops almost as soon as it began, before his hair even dries. He hangs the laundry back out again. It's the first time he's helped with chores. Maybe he feels a bit shy, arranging things as if nothing happened. But Grandma notices what he did in the rain.
